result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Benjamin R. Pfeiffer

records.addlTxt: TRIAL SCHEDULING ORDER
No contact directly or indirectly with victim L.T or C.A.C. , his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. 1 time visit with police to obtain belongings.

3:00 PM Defendant Benjamin R. Pfeiffer in court.  Attorney Walter H Isaacson in court for Benjamin R. Pfeiffer.  Prosecuting attorney Noah M Tylenda in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Jury selection scheduled for March 13, 2023 at 08:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for March 13, 2023 at 08:00 am.
Final pre-trial scheduled for February 16, 2023 at 01:45 pm.
CC

Victim has requested to be present at all proceedings.
Victim has requested to be notified of all proceedings.
Victim has requested to be present at sentencing hearing.
Initial Scheduling Order
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 22, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
10:59 AM Defendant waives preliminary hearing freely and voluntarily, information filed, copy to defendant and reading waived. Defendants attorney enters plea of not guilty on behalf of defendant.

10:59 AM Prosecuting attorney Margaret Nan Ginocchio appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Benjamin R. Pfeiffer appeared by video.  Attorney Walter H Isaacson appeared by video for Benjamin R. Pfeiffer. Court orders warrant recalled previous bond reinstated
Original Warrant returned August 12, 2022.
JPD

9:29 AM Prosecuting attorney Mary Elizabeth Bricco appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Benjamin R. Pfeiffer not in court.  Attorney Walter H Isaacson appeared by video for Benjamin R. Pfeiffer. Court orders warrant on defendant's non-appearance. Cash bond set of $1000.
Preliminary hearing on August 8, 2022 at 09:30 am.

3:39 PM Prosecuting attorney Cheniqua White appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Benjamin R. Pfeiffer appeared by video.  Attorney C. James Fitzgerald appeared by video for Benjamin R. Pfeiffer. Court sets preliminary hearing within time limits by zoom.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 09:30 am.
